body_html:
@dbarta : Do you see this problem only when random initialization is involved?
(Want to confirm that you don't see this issue if a and b have the same value between runs - and indeed the issue is only when you expect two calls to a random initializer with the same seed to produce the same value)
body_text:
@dbarta : Do you see this problem only when random initialization is involved?
(Want to confirm that you don't see this issue if a and b have the same value between runs - and indeed the issue is only when you expect two calls to a random initializer with the same seed to produce the same value)
body:
@dbarta : Do you see this problem only when random initialization is involved?
(Want to confirm that you don't see this issue if `a` and `b` have the same value between runs - and indeed the issue is only when you expect two calls to a random initializer with the same seed to produce the same value)
